{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3209854,"name":"Brooks Bell","username":"hydry","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hydry/{size}/200627_2.png","created_at":"2023-05-23T02:01:38.967Z","cooked":"

I was doing some research into then MAXSpline shaft and I want to know how your team uses it (if your team uses it), just to see if we can use it next build season.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-05-23T02:01:38.967Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2178,"reads":703,"readers_count":702,"score":11055.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":437454,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev","display_username":"Brooks Bell","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58486,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815 Blue Builder"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev/437454/1","custom_user_title":"2815 Blue Builder","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3209859,"name":"","username":"bianca","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bianca/{size}/221825_2.png","created_at":"2023-05-23T02:28:45.250Z","cooked":"

We really liked using it as the pivot point for our arm this year. It’s also fairly easy to put on/adapt an encoder to it, especially the rev through bore encoder. It’s also incredibly durable (much more than hex shaft) and we noticed that if it breaks, it tend to sort of chip more than actually breaking the entire shaft.

We did the same and made a custom delrin bushing so it spins nicely. We routered out maxspline shapes in our arm so it was keyed and attached an encoder using the hex adapter for maxspline

So I am confused how you got the shaft to spin, did you have to make something custom, or is there something you can purchase that makes this easier. I have been looking at cad models of the shaft and I cant find much without needing an adapter to hex shaft.

Is this the only way you can get it to spin nicely? without needing an adapter to have a hex bearing.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-05-23T03:54:41.465Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":573,"readers_count":572,"score":154.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":437454,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58486,"username":"hydry","name":"Brooks Bell","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hydry/{size}/200627_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52512,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"live kwaq love ♡ 2423 & 777 alum"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev/437454/7","custom_user_title":"live kwaq love ♡ 2423 & 777 alum","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3209889,"name":"Emilio Parra","username":"Emilio","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emilio/{size}/197052_2.png","created_at":"2023-05-23T04:02:30.171Z","cooked":"

For our 4-bar, we transferred the torque using the max spline to have the mechanism be as thin as possible. This also allowed us to use a 1/2 rounded hex as a levered dead-axle, lightening the entire assembly. The max-spline lengths were only .453 in. We used a 3d-printed bushing between the hex and the maxspline

image533×766 77.3 KB

Other teams had interesting uses. 27 used it as their arm.

image1024×683 109 KB

docs.revrobotics.com

Tubes / Bushings / Axles

This document might spark some inspiration on how to use it. But remember that the max spline is meant to make your life easier, not harder.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-05-23T04:05:09.803Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":540,"readers_count":539,"score":143.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":437454,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev","display_username":"Emilio Parra","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.revrobotics.com/ion-build-system/motion/tubes-bushings-axles#application-example","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Tubes / Bushings / Axles - ION BUILD SYSTEM","clicks":142}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58486,"username":"hydry","name":"Brooks Bell","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hydry/{size}/200627_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":42196,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847 & Photon 8515"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev/437454/9","custom_user_title":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847 & Photon 8515","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3209895,"name":"Benjamin Broudy","username":"Benjamin_Broudy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/5e9695/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-05-23T04:44:28.961Z","cooked":"

Yeah the bushing makes it spin real nice. Idk if i would trust the dead axle with that much load

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-05-23T04:44:28.961Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":522,"readers_count":521,"score":119.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":437454,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev","display_username":"Benjamin Broudy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58486,"username":"hydry","name":"Brooks Bell","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hydry/{size}/200627_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52302,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev/437454/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3209912,"name":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","username":"Nate_Laverdure","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nate_laverdure/{size}/134005_2.png","created_at":"2023-05-23T10:43:46.657Z","cooked":"

Triple Helix’s 2023 robot used MAXSpline in two joints of our 3-jointed arm, to synchronize the two sides of the mechanism.

A slide about how our lower arm joint works:

image-23-11054×794 244 KB

A previous writeup about how MAXSpline was used in the next arm joint:

Difficulty Inserting MAXSpline Shaft into MAXSpline Holes Technical
I originally had some doubts about the need for a new COTS “build system” for FRC, but after this experience, I am jazzed about MAXSpline as a product, and I now feel like I need to dig deeper into the greater ION system because I’m curious to see how it can be leveraged to full effect. I think it uniquely, neatly, and compactly solves the problem of communicating big shaft torques (and to a lesser degree, bending moments carried by these shafts) across the tens-of-inches distances that are com…
","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-05-23T10:44:27.324Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":29,"reads":507,"readers_count":506,"score":276.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":437454,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev","display_username":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/difficulty-inserting-maxspline-shaft-into-maxspline-holes/427656/10","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Difficulty Inserting MAXSpline Shaft into MAXSpline Holes","clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/0/e/0edc4a5b9449d7af5a347708b266f105705e16a2.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":4999,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cynicism isn't wisdom"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev/437454/11","custom_user_title":"Cynicism isn't wisdom","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3209927,"name":"Jon Stratis","username":"Jon_Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png","created_at":"2023-05-23T13:02:53.567Z","cooked":"

We used it with their dead axle configuration, and it worked really nicely. One of their sprockets on the MAXSpline, bolted to each side of the arm going down to the motor. The spline kept the two bars of the arm aligned and we never had to worry about twisting the shaft.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-05-23T13:02:53.567Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":458,"readers_count":457,"score":151.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":437454,"topic_slug":"how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev","display_username":"Jon Stratis","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC"},"post_url":"/t/how-to-use-maxspline-shaft-from-rev/437454/12","custom_user_title":"FRC 2177 Mentor, LRI, MN RPC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3209942,"name":"Brendan Simons, 5406","username":"nuclearnerd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuclearnerd/{size}/7324_2.png","created_at":"2023-05-23T14:02:12.165Z","cooked":"

You can use maxspline as a live axle with 35mm ID bearings. We used these:

mcmaster.com

McMaster-Carr

McMaster-Carr is the complete source for your plant with over 595,000 products. 98% of products ordered ship from stock and deliver same or next day.

If we did it again, i’d 3D print some kind of splined insert or use wider bearings because they tended to deform the shaft under heavy loads, making the joint a little sloppy over time.

These plain bearings would also work:

mcmaster.com

McMaster-Carr

McMaster-Carr is the complete source for your plant with over 595,000 products. 98% of products ordered ship from stock and deliver same or next day.

Thriftybot has radial and flanged versions of these bearings in stock now

The Thrifty Bot

QTY 2 - 35mm x 47mm Ball Bearings

These bearing options are perfect for supporting spline shafts. The bearings slide on easily in our testing. Flanged version: 35mm ID x 47mm OD x 7mm overall width - 1.5mm thick flange - .070 lbs Radial version: 35mm ID x 47mm OD x 7mm overall width...
